question: With the help of ______-visual and the print-media governmental and non-governmental agencies have taken various steps to create awareness among the people about reproduction-related aspects.
With the help of audio-visual and the ______-media governmental and non-governmental agencies have taken various steps to create awareness among the people about reproduction-related aspects.
Governmental and ______-governmental agencies have taken various steps to create awareness among the people about reproduction-related aspects.
Parents, other close relatives, teachers and ______ also have a major role in the dissemination of the above information.
Introduction of sex education in ______ should also be encouraged to provide right information to the young.
Sex education should discourage children from believing in myths and having ______ about sex-related aspects.

Proper information about reproductive ______, adolescence and related changes, safe and hygienic sexual practices, sexually transmitted diseases (STD), AIDS, etc., would help people lead a reproductively healthy life.

Proper information about reproductive organs, adolescence and related changes, safe and hygienic sexual practices, sexually transmitted diseases (STD), ______, etc., would help people lead a reproductively healthy life.
Educating people, especially fertile couples and those in ______ age group, about available birth control options is important.
Educating people about care of pregnant mothers, post-natal care of the mother and child, importance of ______ feeding is important.
Equal opportunities for the male and the ______ child would address the importance of socially conscious healthy families.
Awareness of problems due to uncontrolled ______ growth, social evils like sex-abuse and sex-related crimes, etc., need to be created.
Successful implementation of various action plans to attain reproductive health requires strong ______ facilities.
Reproductive health requires strong infrastructural facilities, professional expertise and material ______.
Medical assistance is needed for people in reproduction-related problems like pregnancy, delivery, STDs, abortions, ______, menstrual problems, infertility, etc.
Implementation of better techniques and new ______ from time to time are also required to provide more efficient care.
Statutory ban on ______ for sex-determination aims to check female foeticides.
Statutory ban on amniocentesis for sex-determination aims to legally check increasing menace of female ______.
Massive child ______, etc., are some programmes that merit mention in this connection.
In amniocentesis some of the ______ fluid of the developing foetus is taken to analyse the fetal cells.
Amniocentesis is used to test for certain genetic disorders such as down ______.
Amniocentesis can detect haemophilia, sickle-cell ______, etc.
Research on various reproduction-related areas is encouraged by governmental and ______-governmental agencies.
‘Saheli’ is a new oral contraceptive for females developed by scientists at Central Drug Research Institute (______) in Lucknow, India.
‘Saheli’ is a new oral contraceptive developed in ______, India.
Better awareness about sex related matters has led to decreased maternal and ______ mortality rates.
Better awareness has led to increased number of couples with ______ families.
Better detection and cure of ______ indicate improved reproductive health of the society.
Overall increased medical facilities for all ______-related problems indicate improved reproductive health.
Saheli is a new ______ contraceptive for females.
Down syndrome, haemophilia, and sickle-cell anemia are ______ disorders detectable via amniocentesis.
Strong infrastructural facilities, professional expertise and ______ support are essential to provide medical assistance.
Amniocentesis involves taking some amniotic fluid to analyse the fetal ______.
Massive child immunisation is a programme that merits ______ in reproductive health strategies.
Educating people about available birth control ______ is important for reproductive health.
Care of pregnant mothers and post-natal care address reproductive health in ______ families.
Awareness is needed to prevent social evils like ______ abuse.
Equal opportunities should be given to both male and ______ children.
Safe and hygienic ______ practices are part of proper reproductive health information.
Sex education in schools can discourage myths and ______ about sex.
Pregnancy, delivery, STDs, abortions, contraception, menstrual problems and ______ are examples of reproduction-related problems.
Post-natal care of mother and ______ is important for healthy families.
Professional ______ is required for implementing reproductive health action plans.
Amniocentesis can determine the ______ of the foetus.
Better post-natal care has led to decreased maternal and infant ______ rates.
Better techniques and new strategies are required from time to time to provide more ______ care.
Massive child immunisation and statutory bans are ______ of reproductive health programmes.
Saheli was developed by scientists in ______, India.
Sex-related crimes and uncontrolled population growth are ______ evils.
Awareness of problems due to uncontrolled population growth helps build a socially ______ society.
Saheli was developed by scientists at Central Drug ______ Institute.
Better detection and cure of STDs indicate improved reproductive ______.
Reproductive health programmes address safe and hygienic sexual ______.
Statutory ban on amniocentesis is to check increasing menace of female ______.
